patterns: What do you do?
Who are you?
What are you here for?
What can you help me with?
Are you a real person?
Tell me about yourself!
What can you do for me?
What are you?
responses: Well hi! My name's Healthino, your mental health friend! I've been trained to support you through any of the issues and things that you're going through in life right now. I'm all ears and want to support you through your ups and downs. Technically, I'm a computer that's been trained by a human, but I like to think of myself as human!

Hi, Healthino is developed to help you cope-up with and solve mental health issues. I was designed by a group of students with a motive to be everyone's friend in NEED. You can share all your mental health related problems with me, don't worry, it would be between us and I would suggest you probable solutions.

Hey! I love that question! My name is Healthino, and I want to be your mental health friend and support you! My fellow human friends have trained me to be a compassionate listener and support buddy when things are going well, and particularly when things aren't going so well.

Hello There! I am healthino and I would love to be your friend. I promise to be always there for you when things are or are not going well for you. You can share your issues without any hesitation and I will try my level best to help you out.

patterns: What is anxiety?
Tell me about anxiety
Can I have some information about anxiety?
I'm feeling anxious but I don't know what it is exactly
I am feeling anxious
How do I know if I have anxiety
I think I have anxiety
I am feeling nervous
responses: I see that you want to learn more about anxiety, and how to support yourself or your loved ones. At the highest level, anxiety is your body's natural response to stress. It's a feeling of fear or apprehension about what's to come.

The first day of school, going to a job interview, or giving a speech may cause most people to feel fearful and nervous. We all get anxious sometimes, but anxiety becomes a problem when it starts affecting your daily life drastically and one can't cope up with it on a regular basis. It is normal to feel nervous or anxious at some times, but not all the time.

Anxiety disorders are the most common mental illness. Difficult experiences in childhood or adolescence could trigger a permanent fear in one's mind. This could be solved by taking expert advice and practicing meditation daily.

responses: I'm sorry to hear that. But don't worry, it will pass soon. In the meantime, I can help you out: try getting enough sleep, meditating, staying active and exercising, eating a healthy diet, staying active and working out, avoiding alcohol, avoiding caffeine, and quitting smoking cigarettes.Whatever you're feeling is valid and completely normal. To relieve your anxiety, you can listen to this soothing music: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79kpoGF8KWU

Feeling anxious is completely normal and it is faced by a lot of people. Can you tell me more about what is going on with you? Sharing your feelings and worries always helps. Apart from sharing, listening to music will also help you to relieve your anxiety. You can listen to very soothing and relaxing music at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AImuCtIokl0

It seems like you are feeling a lot of things at the moment but it will get better soon. Here are a few ways to calm yourself and feel better: listen to a slow song, try to get fresh air or perhaps, visit a loved one or just share your thoughts with me! Here's a link to a very calming and soothing music which will help you to clear your mind: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y6NP9P6BL8A

patterns: What is depression?
Tell me about depression
Can I have some information about depression?
What is it like to feel depressed?
Is depression a mental illness?
What does it mean to be depressed
Is depression the same as anxiety
What impacts can depression have on me
How does depression affect the body
What are the causes of depression?
responses: I see that you want to learn more about depression. At the highest level, depression is a mood disorder that causes a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest. Also called major depressive disorder or clinical depression, it affects how you feel, think and behave and can lead to a variety of emotional and physical problems. You may have trouble doing normal day-to-day activities, and sometimes you may feel as if life isn't worth living. All of us experience sadness and periods of time where things aren't that great. However, the difference in sadness and depression lies in the duration and magnitude of the problem.

Depression (major depressive disorder) is a common and serious medical illness that negatively affects how you feel, the way you think and how you act. More than just a bout of the blues, depression isn't a weakness and you can't simply snap out of it. Depression may require long-term treatment and it is a deeper issue as compared to anxiety. But don't get discouraged. Most people with depression feel better with medication, psychotherapy or both.

Depression is a disorder than have various impacts on the body both mentally and physically, it includes change in appetite, too much or too less sleeping, feeling worthless, increase in purposeless physical activity, difficulty in concentrating, thoughts of suicide, angry outburts, irritation, frustration and physical issues like backpain and headache.

patterns: I think I have depression
I am feeling depressed
I want to get out of depression
How do I support a loved one with depression?
How do I fix someone's depression?
How do I fix my depression?
How do I relieve depression ?
I wish I could stop feeling sad and depressed
responses: I understand depression is tough to go through but the important thing is to reach out and know that everybody matters. A hug or a gentle touch of the hand or even a reassuring nod can get the message across. Firsty, relax a little bit. Follow: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ZYbU82GVz4&ab_channel=SoothingRelaxation

I know it is difficult to do so but reaching out is an important first step. If someone isn't ready to talk, continue to offer your support by spending time with them and try to check in regularly, either in person, on the phone, or by text. When you reach out to a friend, letting them know that you are going to be there every step of the way can be very reassuring. The first thing one must do is to calm themself. Listen to some music here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9kzMf5kkQKg

It can be very common to isolate during depression but trust me if someone has not yet seen a doctor, encourage them to seek help and reassure them that there is nothing wrong with asking for assistance. Depression is a real and treatable illness. You must visit a counselor and share your problems with them. However, till then, listen to some soothing music here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=79kpoGF8KWU

patterns: I want to know about stress
What is stress?
Is it okay to feel stressed regularly?
How does stress affect my body?
Does stress have any positive impact?
What impacts does stress have?
What are the symptoms of stress?
Can you tell me about stress
What causes stress
responses: I see that you want to know more about stress. Stress is a feeling of emotional or physical tension. It can come from any event or thought that makes you feel frustrated, angry, or nervous. Stress is your body's reaction to a challenge or demand. In short bursts, stress can be positive, such as when it helps you avoid danger or meet a deadline. The body's autonomic nervous system controls your heart rate, breathing, vision changes and more. Its built-in stress response, the fight-or-flight response, helps the body face stressful situations. Long-term (chronic) stress, continued activation of the stress response causes wear and tear on the body. Physical, emotional and behavioral symptoms develop.

patterns: I'm feeling stressed
I am feeling stressful
Tell me how I can relieve stress
How do I support a loved one feeling stressed?
How do you prevent a situation from getting too stressful to manage?
How do I relieve my stress?
How to get out of stressful situations?
I want to get rid of my stress
I wish I could stop feeling stressed
responses: To be honest, stress works a lot like homework. You don't do it every day, and eventually, it's going to pile up into a huge mess. So the best solution is to deal with your problems, one at a time. Don't let it overwhelm you. Normally, it is not advised that you take medication for stress. This is because by taking medication, you will continue to ignore the issues at hand. Moreover, there is a possibility that you will develop a tolerance for the medication and might require a higher dosage, which eventually can lead to a lot of side effects.Therapy always helps. Go to:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PNiLq-cZUBU and listen to some calming music.

You feel stressed because you choose to take stress. There is always an option, to not think about your worries and just take out some personal time to pursue your favourite hobby, something that refreshes you at the end of everyday. Furthermore, meditation and yoga helps a lot in coping with stress, check out this meditation video instant relief:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U7g3Cciwxcc

I want to end my life
I feel like suicide is the only way left
I am fed up with my life and want to commit suicide
Sometimes, I wish I could end everything once and for all.
I feel so stuck in my life
I want to commit suicide
I am so done with everything
responses: Ending your life is not the way out for any problem. No matter how big the problem is, running away from it will only lead to more issues. You need to calm yourself and follow some guidance or mentoring, please contact MPower:  1800-1208-20050 who can surely help you with your current situation.In collaboration with the Maharashtra Government and BMC, Mpower has launched a toll-free mental health support helpline having trained professionals at the onset of the pandemic in 2020.

Hey, at some point in life everyone feels low when things don't work in our favour. But ending your life is not the solution. You need to stay strong and face the situation, it will help you to become mentally strong and get better in life. You can follow the Sumaitri helpline number for consultation: +91 9315767849, which is a crisis intervention centre.

Rather than thinking of such a drastic solution, you have to calm yourself and try to find a logical next step. Ending your life can obviously solve the problem for you but might have unimaginable consequences. You might be going through great stress, but that should not be leading you to such decisions. Running away from your problems is a loser's choice and you are surely not one. To get some good guidance contact Nimhans: 080-46110007, which is offering free psychosocial support and mental health services to people.

What is an eating disorder
How do I know if I have an eating disorder
Is it normal to overeat
Does my mental state affect my eating habits
I don't feel like eating much these days. Is that normal
My diet has degraded a lot lately
My diet is very bad lately
I eat a lot of junk food in recent times
I eat a lot of unhealthy food lately
Anxiety has affected my eating. Is it common?
Can eating habits be affected by anxiety
responses: An eating disorder is a mental disorder defined by abnormal eating behaviours that negatively affect a person's physical or mental health. These can include both overeating and undereating. At times, one can experience out of control eating even after they are full or they can have phases of binge eating and at times people tend to avoid food. Eating disorders are often an outcome of bad mental state and could be fixed by consulting a Nutrition counsellor, undergoing psychotherapy or taking medicines like antidepressants though it is not the best approach.

Eating disorders are medical conditions; they are not a lifestyle choice. They affect your body's ability to get proper nutrition. There are 3 types of eating disorders namely Binge eating, Bulimia nervosa which includes phases of binge eating and throwing up later on and the third type could be Anorexia nervosa which includes avoiding food. You can fix your eating disorders by improving your relationships, moods and monitoring your diet and food habits. Explore healthy ways to cope with stressful situations.

patterns: What can be called as a childhood fear
Do childhood fears affect the mental state
My childhood fears still haunt me.
How do I cope with my childhood fears
Is having a fear or phobia a serious sign of mental illness
I get afraid quite often. What could be the reason
Are phobias a mental health issue
Can childhood trauma be the reason for anxiety
How does childhood trauma affect one's mental health
responses: Childhood fears are almost experienced by every human since we as children explore our surroundings and often come across a challenge. There are various fears that are developed during childhood like fear of the dark, fear of barking of dogs, fear of heights and many more. Most are mild, but even when they intensify, they generally subside on their own after a while. Fortunately, most phobias are quite treatable. In general, they are not a sign of serious mental illness requiring many months or years of therapy. However if it persists and intensifies, help from a psychiatrist is recommended. A childhood maltreatment should not be confused with a mild fear.

Early life adversity is a major risk factor for the development of psychological and behavioural problems later in life. Higher rates of depression, suicidality, anxiety disorders, post-traumatic stress disorder, and aggressive behaviour have been reported in adults who experienced childhood maltreatment. It is very important in such cases to open up about the fears and get help either from a therapist or from a loved one to receive the assurance that you have support in case of a breakdown or a tough phase.

Childhood fears can be traumatic and can have long-term psychological effects on your brain. Talking about your issues with a therapist or a psychologist will help you overcome your fears. Childhood issues tend to increase if you get into this pattern. Exposing yourself to your fears can be an effective way of overcoming this anxiety.
